text: Marking of military equipment of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation involved in Russia's invasion of Ukraine on February 24, 2022. Symbols V and Z were called swastikas in the media and were banned by the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine as symbols of the military invasion of Ukraine by the Russian neo-Nazi totalitarian regime. Also banned in some countries. https://www.bbc.com/russian/news-61131224.amp As a militarist symbol, the "Z" has been used in Russian propaganda, and by Russian civilians as a sign of support for the invasion. Outside Russia, the symbol has been banned from public display in several states. The "Z" symbol has been called a zwastika in the media, derived from the word swastika. *O (symbol): Russian Armed Forces at Izium are carrying that symbol; Media said that on April 25.https://www.aftenposten.no/verden/i/0Gy5wE/25000-russiske-soldater-staar- fast-i-en-hengemyr-det-store-slaget-i-oest-startet-ikke-slik-putin-droemte. Aftenposten. Retrieved April 25, 2022 == References == Category:2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine
title: Marking of military equipment of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation
